alert.note: Alert for Rockingham; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 12:54PM EST until December 21 at 2:30AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Carroll and Oxford Counties. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Belknap and Merrimack Counties. Lamprey River Near Newmarket affecting Rockingham and Strafford Counties. Warner River At Davisville affecting Merrimack County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Merrimack River AT Goffs Falls affecting Rockingham, Hillsborough and Merrimack Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lamprey River near Newmarket. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
